Cytoplasmic heakage and Transplantation Experiments:
l. Induce phenocopies associated with the anterior and posterior
maternal effect genes in* eggs using the cytoplasmic leakage
and transplantation schemes shown in Fig. l, A-G (see previous page
of handout).=
2. Attempt to rescue the effect of the hypermorphic spliced mutation
by: 1 
. a. leaking cytoplasm from the center of splc/splc eggs.
b. transplanting cytoplasm from the posterior tip of splc/splc
eggs to the presumptive central abdominal region of other splc/splc
eggs. 1111- 
3. Attempt to rescue the effect of the torso mutation by transplanting
cytoplasm from splc/splc eggs to the terminal regions of tor/tor eggs.

vmeeL  Fig. l. A fate map of the Drosophila blastodertn (from Campos-Ortega Hartenstein, 1985). The shape is a
planimetric reconstruction of the blastodenn surface. All parts of the egg surface contribute to the embryo proper,
except the narrow dorsal primordium for the arnnioserosa Hatched areas will invaginate at gastmlation. Cells that
will generate metameric structures are enclosed by a thick line. Abbreviations: omg, anterior midgut; as, amnioserosa;
cl, clypeolabrum; dEpi, dorsal epidermis; dr, dorsal ridge; er, oesophagus; mt, Malpighian tubules; MS, mesoderm;
ol, optic lobe; ph, pharynx; pmg, posterior midgut; procephalic neurogenic region; 
pr. proctodeum; sg, salivary gland; ventral neurogenic region; M, mandibular segment; Mx, maxillary segment;
La, labial segment; Tl-73, thoracic segments; AI-AIO, abdominal segments; ant, anterior; dors, dorsal.
